title: Good Posture review: Grace Van Patten stands out in a fresh, frosty literary comedy
text:
Dir: Dolly Wells; Starring: Grace Van Patten, Emily Mortimer, Timm Sharp, John Early, Ebon Moss-Bachrach, Norbert Leo Butz. 15 cert, 92 mins.

Epistolary novels have been a literary mainstay for at least 200 years, but epistolary films – think The Shop Around The Corner, 84 Charing Cross Road, even The Lake House – are a rarer species. With her self-penned directorial debut, the actress Dolly Wells has made a nice addition to the canon: a slim, elusive comedy about a frosty English novelist and her aimless young American house guest, who communicate almost exclusively through notes scribbled in a private diary.

The diary’s owner is Lilian (Grace Van Patten), a New York-based film school graduate...
